intro: Acnida obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved acnida, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are usually smooth and have a slightly waxy texture. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the warmer months. Acnida obtusifolia is often found in grasslands and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
